1.title: The Judges Do Battle: Part 1
1.plot: A group of 43 talented home cooks participate in the battle of the apron challenge, where they will compete for a position in the top 24.

2.title: The Judges Do Battle: Part 2
2.plot: The judges each will have eight aprons to hand out to the home cooks whom they deem worthy.

3.title: The Judges Do Battle: Part 3
3.plot: The final home cooks compete for the last 9 aprons to fill the final spots of the field of 24 competing for the Master Chef title.

4.title: Home State Heroes
4.plot: In the first mystery box challenge of the season the top 24 must prep, cook, and plate one dish featuring an ingredient unique to each of their home states.

5.title: Gordon Ramsay Masterclass
5.plot: In the first skills test of the season, Gordon teaches the home cooks how to properly break down a crab before the contestants must replicate his work. Those whose skills don't cut it face an elimination challenge during which Gordon will show them how to make his signature Crab Benedict dish. It is then up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home.

6.title: Trouble Brewing
6.plot: The Top 20 chefs face the first team challenge of the season at the Anheuser Busch brewery. Teams must cook a beer-infused lunch for more than 100 employees. The team that receives the least amount of votes will head back to the kitchen for a banana cream pie pressure test that will determine who will be eliminated.

7.title: World Cup Dishes
7.plot: The contestants face a mystery box challenge where they must create a dish using one common ingredient walnuts. The winner will receive 3 huge advantages.Later, the MasterChef kitchen welcomes American soccer legend, Alexi Lalas, who will introduce a street-food themed elimination challenge that involves popular food among soccer fans in various countries. Then, it is up to the judges to decide who will be sent home.

8.title: A Gordon Ramsay Wedding
8.plot: The contestants head to Malibu, California, and cook for Season 7 winner Shaun O'Neale's wedding with Gordon Ramsay officiating! After splitting into 2 teams, the home cooks have limited time to prepare and cook 51 appetizers and 51 entrees for guests in attendance. Then, it is up to the judges to decide who stays and who heads home.

9.title: The Big Not Easy
9.plot: The contestants face a mystery box filled with fresh seafood and must create a dish using 2 items from it. The chefs who fail to impress the judges face an elimination challenge and are asked to upgrade one of the most popular frozen dinner dishes, Salisbury Steak. Then, it is up to the judges to decide who heads home.

10.title: Rise or Fall
10.plot: The remaining home cooks pair up for a skills test to create a restaurant-quality dish featuring five ingredients - only to leave one contestant without a pair. The contestant cooking solo gets a huge advantage in the challenge and gets the opportunity to cook alongside his/her mentor. The chefs who fail to impress the judges will face an elimination challenge and create the ever-challenging cheese soufflé in just 40 minutes. Then, it is up to the judges to decide who will head home.

11.title: The Kids are Alright
11.plot: The Top 14 contestants are split into 2 teams to compete in a fine-dining challenge to cook 39 dishes for a group of very discerning judges. Contestants are surprised when the diners are revealed, forcing them to scramble and alter their dishes to accommodate the guests. Ultimately the winning team's recipe will be printed in Family Circle Magazine. The losing team competes in a cupcake pressure test with special guest Christina Tosi. The judges then decide who stays and who is sent home.

12.title: Frying Tonight
12.plot: The Top 13 contestants face a mystery box challenge with a stockpot and cooking oil and are tasked with making a dish that features a deep-fried element. An extra layer of pressure is put on the contestants as the judges cook alongside them. The winner of the challenge receives an advantage in the elimination challenge to create a citrus-centered dish. The judges then decide who stays and who is sent home.

13.title: Just for the Halibut
13.plot: The Top 12 face their third skills test in the MasterChef kitchen and replicate the proper way to break down a halibut. Those who fail to impress the judges are then tasked with creating a stunning original dish using their broken-down fish. Some contestants yield a bountiful filet, while others offer up a poor portion of protein. Ultimately, the judges decide who is left floundering and sent home.

14.title: Sky's the Limit
14.plot: The remaining home cooks take on their 5th Mystery Box challenge, using "Ingredients America Was Built On." In the elimination challenge, the contestants split into teams and recreate a Mediterranean platter. The top 2 winners are rewarded as team captains for their next Field Challenge, and someone is sent home.

15.title: Tag Team
15.plot: The 8 remaining home cooks divide into 2 teams and race against the clock to serve restaurant-quality dishes to 25 California firefighters. Ultimately, the firefighters will decide the winning team, while the losing team will face a pasta-themed pressure test where someone is sent home.

16.title: American Heroes
16.plot: The 8 remaining home cooks divide into 2 teams and race against the clock to serve restaurant-quality dishes to 25 California firefighters. Ultimately, the firefighters will decide the winning team, while the losing team will face a pasta-themed pressure test where someone is sent home.

17.title: Waste Not Want Not
17.plot: The 7 remaining contestants face a Mystery Box challenge filled with waste literally. The home cook who makes the best dish from food scraps will be safe in the elimination challenge, during which they'll take on another Mystery Box Challenge, but this time with all the best and freshest ingredients. Find out whose time has come to an end.

18.title: Restaurant Takeover
18.plot: The Top 6 face the Restaurant Takeover Challenge at Providence in Los Angeles. The home cooks split into 2 teams and must feed a dining room filled with 48 guests. The judges will evaluate each team's performance and the losing team will face the challenging pressure test, after which someone will be sent home.

19.title: Cooking with Heart
19.plot: The remaining five cooks receive a heart-warming mystery box challenge in which contestants create a dish inspired by their loved ones.

20.title: Battle of the Beef
20.plot: The Top 5 home cooks face a series of pressure-filled skills tests using an incredibly common protein beef. The judges decide which contestant claims a safe spot on the balcony and who faces another culinary test. The 2 weakest home cooks go head-to-head to claim the final spot in the Top 4, while the other is cut.

21.title: The Semi Final
21.plot: The final 4 are split into 2 teams and need to cook one incredible entree for the judges mentors Chefs Daniel Boulud Jonathan Waxman and Lidia Bastianich. The judges choose which winning team moves on leaving the final 2 to battle it out in a do or die pressure test. Find out which 3 make it to the finale.

22.title: Finale: Part 1
22.plot: The three finalists (Ashley, Cesar and Gerron) compete in the final rounds to become the winner of the 9th season of 'Masterchef'.

23.title: Finale: Part 2
23.plot: The home cook with the best overall menu is crowned the winner wih a prize of a quarter of a million dollars and the coveted title of MasterChef.

1.title: Auditions #1
1.plot: The contestants have one hour to cook one dish.

2.title: Auditions #2
2.plot: The contestants have one hour to cook one dish.

3.title: Top 14 Revealed
3.plot: The contestants take 2 basic skills tests: 1st to chop onions and continue until judges tells them to stop, the judges dissect the chopped onions, if they don't meet the judge's standards, they are eliminated.The 2nd was to cook one egg any style using any ingredients in 30 minutes.

4.title: 14 Chefs Compete
4.plot: For their first mystery box challenge the contestants had 45 minutes to create a dish using a double cut pork chop with other ingredients.

5.title: Top 11 Compete
5.plot: For their first team challenge, the contestants cook for one hundred marines and their families.

6.title: Top 9 Compete
6.plot: The contestants were given ingredients to make one cupcake.

7.title: Top 6 Compete
7.plot: The contestants cook hamburgers for 100 truck drivers.

8.title: Winner Revealed
8.plot: The contestants were given sixty minutes to prepare a dish using a live Dungeness crab.

1.title: Auditions #1
1.plot: Masterchef hopefuls will prepare their signature dishes and present them to judges Gordon Ramsay, Joe Bastianich and Graham Elliot. The amateur cooks will be put through the paces, and only the most deserving will win a white apron and move on to the next round of the competition.

2.title: Audition #2
2.plot: Nerves are tested as the judges continue to winnow down the Top 100 in their search for the America's best amateur cook.

3.title: Top 38 Revealed
3.plot: The auditions continue and as usual the contestants have five minutes to cook their signature dishes in front of the judges. Once they receive at least two votes from the three judges, they receive a white apron.

5.title: Top 16 Revealed
5.plot: For their first mystery box challenge the contestants had sixty minutes to create a dish with salmon as the main ingredient as well as other ingredients as well.

6.title: Top 16 Compete
6.plot: The contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook for five-course meal which consisted of a soup, a salad, pizza, a special entrée and a dessert for three hundred and fifty office workers.

7.title: Top 15 Compete
7.plot: The contestants had sixty to create a dish consisting of a rack of New Zealand lamb and other ingredients.

8.title: Top 14 Compete
8.plot: For their next team challenge The contestants were split into 2 teams and had to cook a sausage sandwich for 101 bikers then the bikers would vote and the first team to receive 51 votes would win.

9.title: Top 13 Compete
9.plot: Season one winner Whitney Miller returned to present her new cookbook.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: The contestants were brought to Ramsay's restaurant, The London West Hollywood hotel to cater for Hollywood party. The contestants were required to make 3 different Hors d oeuvres, a beef, vegetable and desert.

11.title: Top 11 Compete
11.plot: For their 4th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had to cook fresh lobster.

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: The contestants were divided into two teams and were required to cook a three course meal for the judge's mothers. The captain for each team spent 2 minutes with the mothers to find out what kind of foods the mothers like and dislike.

13.title: Mystery Box Challenge 5
13.plot: For their fifth Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had to cook a dish using three hand-dived scallops and other ingredients.

14.title: Episode #2.14
14.plot: The contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook a slider and a side dish for a children's block party without using beef or potatoes.

15.title: Top 8 Compete Again
15.plot: Surf and Turf was the theme for the contestant's 6th Mystery Box Challenge. The Mystery Box consisted of live jumbo shrimp, Alaskan king crab, live craw fish, buffalo rib eye, porterhouse steak, and short ribs.

16.title: Episode #2.16
16.plot: The remaining six contestants were divided into two teams at Patina restaurant and for one dinner service they had to replicate two signature appetizers and two signature entrées from the restaurant's menu.

17.title: Top 5 Compete
17.plot: The top five contestants had to create a dish using ground pork, ground veal, ground beef, and other ingredients.

18.title: Top 4 Compete
18.plot: The top four contestants had cook six portions of the same dish for the three judges of the American version of MasterChef and three guest judges from MasterChef India, MasterChef France, and MasterChef Israel.

19.title: Top 3 Compete
19.plot: final three contestants were required to cook a dish using chicken with other ingredients using any style and any technique in one hour.

20.title: Winner Revealed
20.plot: For the finale Adrien and Jennifer had two hours to cook an appetizer, an entrée, and desert using any ingredients they preferred and cook in any style and any technique.

1.title: Auditions #1
1.plot: The search begins for America's best amateur cook.

2.title: Auditions 2
2.plot: The search continues for America's best amateur cook.

3.title: Top 36 Become 18
3.plot: The remaining hopefuls compete for a spot in the top 18.

4.title: Top 18
4.plot: The top 18 are forced out of their comfort zone.

5.title: Top 16
5.plot: For the first team challenge, the remaining 16 contestants were divided into two teams and were required to cook an entrée for 201 Marines. After tasting both entrées each Marine would vote and the team with the most votes would win the team challenge.

6.title: Top 15
6.plot: Guts are tested as the remaining fifteen contestants are challenged to create a unique dish using unconventional - and unappetizing - cuts of meat. The contestants who are most resourceful and think outside the box will make the cut and continue to the next round.

7.title: Top 14
7.plot: The judges plan a surprise trip for the amateur cooks, but the contestants are in for a rude awakening when the judges split them into teams to prepare hearty breakfast meals for hungry hotel guests. The teams must be organized and work efficiently, but tempers reach a new high during room service. Later, the losing team must prove they deserve to remain in the competition in an emotional elimination round.

8.title: Top 13
8.plot: For their third Mystery Box Challenge the contestants had to cook a T-bone steak with other ingredients.

9.title: Top 12
9.plot: Team challenge: split into 3 teams, each with a food truck serving a different style of food, to sell to visitors at Venice Bench. Earn the most to win.

10.title: Top 11
10.plot: Graham Elliot takes on the mystery box.

11.title: Top 9
11.plot: For their 5th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had 60 minutes to create a dish using a live sea urchin, also known as uni. But first Ramsey showed the contestants had to humanely remove the sea urchin from it's shell.

12.title: Top 8
12.plot: For their 4th team challenge the contestants had to cook steak and two side dishes for 101 cowboys and cowgirls.

13.title: Top 7
13.plot: A guest judge surprises the contestants with a letter from their loved ones and were required to cook with southern ingredients.

14.title: The Return
14.plot: The eliminated contestants return to compete for a "second chance" white apron.

15.title: The New Top 7
15.plot: The final seven contestants had 45 minutes to create a dish using live Santa Barbara spot prawns.

16.title: The Top 6
16.plot: For their 5th team challenge the contestants were divided into two teams and had to cook one dinner service at Hatfield's restaurant.

17.title: Top 5 Battle to Survive
17.plot: The remaining five home cooks select the mystery box ingredients they will need to create a dish that best represents who they are, but the judges surprise the contestants with a game changing twist. Later, in the elimination challenge, the home cooks will have a limited amount of time to conceptualize and recreate one of Graham Elliot's signature dishes that he served to President Barack Obama at his flagship restaurant. Find out whose dish is fit to impress the Commander-in-Chief and who will be sent home.

18.title: The Final 4
18.plot: In the most intimidating challenge of the season, the final four home cooks will split into two teams to prepare an exquisite three-course meal for the judges and three world-renowned chefs: Daniel Boulud, Alain Ducasse and Guy Savoy. The Michelin-starred guest judges will help critique each course and evaluate each dish's flavor, originality and culinary finesse. The winning pair will earn a spot in the Top 3, while the losing team will compete head-to-head in a heated pressure test featuring souffle. Find out who will rise to the occasion and who will collapse under...

19.title: The Top 3
19.plot: The last Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants were allowed to cook a dish they can include if they were given the opportunity to publish their own cookbook. They can use any ingredients, cook in any style use any technique they preferred.

20.title: The Finale
20.plot: THE JUDGES REVEAL AMERICA'S NEXT "MASTERCHEF" ON THE SEASON FINALE OF "MASTERCHEF." The Top Two finalists have one last chance to prove to the judges that they have the passion, skill and drive worthy of the MASTERCHEF title. In their final challenge in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the two home cooks will conceptualize and prepare the most important three-course meal of their lives.

1.title: Auditions #1
1.plot: Each contestant is given 5 minutes to prepare, cook, and present their signature dish to the three judges. If they receive at least 2 yes' from the 3 judges they can advance to the next stage of the competition.

2.title: Auditions # 2
2.plot: The auditions continue where each contestant is given 5 minutes to cook and present their dish in front of and to the judges. If they receive at least two yes's from the three judges, they can advance to the next stage of the competition.

3.title: Auditions #3: Top 19 Revealed
3.plot: Find out which hopefuls make it into the "MasterChef" kitchen.

4.title: Top 19 Compete
4.plot: Find out which hopefuls make it into the "MasterChef" kitchen.

5.title: Top 18 Compete
5.plot: For their first team challenge the contestants had one hour and forty five minutes to cook one entrée and one desert for three hundred elementary school students.

6.title: Top 17 Compete
6.plot: For their sixth Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants cook with Gordon Ramsay, but not competing against him.

8.title: Top 16 Compete: Part 2
8.plot: The contestants take on Sin City.

9.title: Top 15 Chefs Compete
9.plot: The home cooks face a tough pasta critic.

10.title: Top 14 Compete
10.plot: The contestants face another team challenge as they prepare three dishes for the cast and crew of Glee.

11.title: Top 13 Compete
11.plot: The contestants had ninety minutes to cook a dish with parts from a pig's head specifically the ears tongue, cheek, snout using other ingredients from the pantry and cook in any style and using any technique they preferred.

12.title: Top 12 Compete
12.plot: In the next team challenge, the remaining contestants cooked for a wedding reception where they cooked the entrée and Graham cooked the appetizer and Gordon cooked the desert. The menu was created from the likes and dislikes of the bride and groom. The judges would determine which two members of the losing team would compete in the Pressure Test which was to make a dozen Macarons.

13.title: Top 11 Compete
13.plot: A celebrity guest judge created a Mystery Box filled with ingredients from Mexico. They had sixty minutes to create a dish using only these ingredients.

14.title: Top 10 Compete
14.plot: For their next team challenge the contestants cooked fish tacos for one hundred and one suffers at Huntington Beach, California.

15.title: Top 9 Compete
15.plot: The remaining nine contestants had ninety minutes to make a sausage dish from scratch using a meat grinder.

16.title: Top 8 Compete
16.plot: The Top 8 chefs are taken to a remote field for an overnight challenge in which they must cook for sustenance and create lunch for the judges using limited ingredients. Later, the losing team competes in a spun-sugar-dessert pressure test.

17.title: Top 7 Compete
17.plot: The Top 7 chefs compete in a mystery-box challenge in which they create dishes inspired by their loved ones. Later, an elimination round featuring a tag-team sushi challenge takes place.

18.title: One Chef Wins Right to Return
18.plot: The previously eliminated contestants were given a second chance to win back their white apron.

19.title: Top 7 Compete (+ 1 Returnee)
19.plot: The contestants were required to cook a T bone steak in forty five minutes using any technique and cook in any style they preferred.

20.title: Top 6 Compete
20.plot: The remaining six contestants cooked one dinner service at WP24,an Asian inspired restaurant which the dinner service included two appetizers and two entrées.

21.title: Top 5 Compete: Part 1
21.plot: The judges' invited their sons to create a mystery box consisting of fifteen items. The contestants then had sixty minutes to create a restaurant worthy dish using these items and items in a limited pantry.

22.title: Top 5 Compete: Part 2
22.plot: The remaining 5 contestants had to cook 50 portions for a charity lunch hosted by guest judge Paula Deen. The dish consisted of 1 protein and 2 sides. Deen would select the top 2 dishes and those two would be safe from the Pressure Test.

23.title: Top 4 Compete
23.plot: The four contestants were divided into two teams and had two mystery boxes containing fifty ingredients each and were required to make a three course menu consisting of an appetizer, entreé and dessert.

24.title: The Semi-Final
24.plot: The remaining three contestants were given the same exact ingredients they used to create the dish they cooked and presented for their first audition.

25.title: Winner Chosen
25.plot: For the finale the contestants had to cook a three course meal, one hour for each course.The decision was close enough where the judges were considering a draw.

1.title: Top 30 Compete
1.plot: Host award-winning chef Gordon Ramsay, along with fellow judges restaurateur Joe Bastianich and acclaimed chef Graham Elliot return for Season Five, putting the latest group of contestants through a series of challenging elimination rounds and turning one home cook into a culinary master.

2.title: Top 22 Compete
2.plot: In the first mystery box challenge of the season, the Top Finalists will have 90 minutes to prep and cook a unique and impressive dish, using mainly dessert ingredients. The winner of the mystery box will have a significant advantage in the next round, deciding which classic American dish the remaining contestants will have to prepare in the elimination round. Find out who will rise to the occasion and whose dream of becoming America's next MASTERCHEF will come to an end.

3.title: Top 20 Compete
3.plot: It's the ultimate culinary war when the remaining 20 home cooks compete in the biggest field challenge in MASTERCHEF history: feeding an army of 500 servicemen and women on a desert army base. In their first team challenge, the contestants will split into two teams - the red team and the blue team - to create a hearty meal including one protein and two side dishes. Tempers flare as both teams struggle with consistency, and every dish counts as the troops will vote for their favorite dish and determine the winning team. Later, the losing team will face an intense ...

4.title: Top 18 Compete
4.plot: For their second Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had sixty minutes to create a dish with live seafood.

5.title: Top 17 Compete
5.plot: For their 2nd team challenge the contestants were divided into two teams and had two hours to cook for 120 wedding guests.

6.title: Top 16 Compete
6.plot: The 3rd Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants were given 52 unlabeled aluminum and tin cans, and a limited pantry. They can use any amount of cans they preferred, in 60 minutes to create a restaurant quality dish.

7.title: Top 15 Compete
7.plot: For the 3rd team challenge, for 1 hour the contestants worked in pairs cook with seafood and red meat. The teams with the worst dishes would compete in the Pressure Test.

8.title: Top 14 Compete
8.plot: The Restaurant Takeover took place at Dinah's Family Restaurant in Culver City, California.

9.title: Top 13 Compete
9.plot: Thirteen chefs compete in a mystery-box challenge involving wild Alaskan king salmon. In the second round, the home cooks create dishes using a judge's favorite ingredients.

10.title: Top 12 Compete
10.plot: for their 5th Team Challenge, the contestants were divided into 2 teams of 6 and had to cook a romantic entrée and desert for seventeen couples, including Gordon and his wife Tana.

11.title: Episode #5.11
11.plot: For their 5th Mystery Box Challenge, the judges presented 2 Mystery Boxes, one box had cheap ingredients and the other had expensive ingredients, the contestants had 60 minutes to create a dish using only one of the boxes.

12.title: Episode #5.12
12.plot: For their 6th Team Challenge, the cooks were divided into 2 teams and had 1 hour to make a turkey burger and fish taco for the football players and their fans. The players and fans would vote and the losing team will face the pressure test. The pressure test ends with an emotional elimination.

13.title: Episode #5.13
13.plot: For their next team challenge the cooks chose who they wanted to partner up with forming 4 teams of 2, each team would cook with a different body part of the chicken and the body part was randomly chosen.

14.title: Episode #5.14
14.plot: For the 6th Mystery Box Challenge, the contestants had 60 minutes to create an entrée using only apples. They can also include ingredients from the pantry.

15.title: Episode #5.15
15.plot: the remaining 6 contestants cooked dinner at restaurant with 50 guests. They had to replicate 2 appetizers and 2 entrees from the restaurant's menu. They have 1 hour to prep and 2 hours to serve the customers.

16.title: Episode #5.16
16.plot: In 60 minutes the remaining contestants and their loved ones picked the ingredients they needed to make their loved one's favorite dish.

18.title: Top 3 Compete
18.plot: The last 3 cooks cooked an entrée for 50 chefs, symbolizing the 50 states of America. The 3 cooks randomly selected the eliminated contestants to help prepare the 50 portions. The cook with the most votes will advance to the finale.

19.title: The Finale
19.plot: For the finale, Elizabeth and Courtney were required to cook a three course meal for each of the judges.

1.title: Top 40 Compete
1.plot: Top 40 compete in a head to head challenge, to narrow it down to the top 20.

2.title: Top 22 Compete
2.plot: In order to move to the next round, the home cooks must have an immense passion for food and be determined to out-cook their rivals in a series of head-to-head battles to earn a coveted white apron and compete for a chance to win the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize.

3.title: You're the Apple of My Eye
3.plot: After the Battle for the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America will face their first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant is given 20 staple ingredients that anyone could find in their home and tasked with preparing a dish for the judges -- were the judges to show up at their homes for dinner. The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge will receive a significant advantage in the season's first pressure test, during which contestants must make their versions of an apple pie.

4.title: Cinnamon Roll-er Coaster
4.plot: After the apple pie elimination test, the remaining 22 home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season at an amusement park. Once teams are decided, each team will be tasked with creating its version of an amusement park burger and fish and chips dish for thousands of amusement park guests. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team will have to face the first pressure test of the season, during which the home cooks will make 12 cinnamon rolls. Find out which home cooks will continue to ride in the competition and who will ...

5.title: Clawing to Victory
5.plot: In the next mystery box challenge, the home cooks will have to come out of their shells when they must prepare unique crab dishes for the judges. The home cook who prepares the best crab dish will receive a significant advantage before the next elimination challenge. Then the remaining home cooks will create their versions of sweet or savory dishes, using the same surprise ingredient of corn.

6.title: What Happens in Vegas Steaks in Vegas
6.plot: In the second field challenge of the season, the home cooks will take a surprise trip to Las Vegas, where they will be split into two teams to take over Drai's Nightclub and feed 101 Las Vegas performers. The team who receives the most winning votes from the Las Vegas performer diners will be safe from the next pressure test, while the losing team will be dealt with a deuce steak contest at Gordon Ramsay's Steak. In the pressure test, the home cooks will face two steak challenges testing temperature and taste, and one contestant will be sent home for good.

7.title: Bring Home the Bacon
7.plot: In the next challenge, it's proven that Breakfast is indeed the most important meal of the day when the home cooks are each tasked to create an elevated breakfast dish in 45 minutes. Not only will the winner have immunity in the next mystery box challenge, but they will also receive two additional advantages. Later, in the mystery box challenge, contestants must create TV dinners. Find out who will go home and who will bring it home.

8.title: Happy Birthday MasterChef
8.plot: In the next team challenge, the remaining home cooks will celebrate a MASTERCHEF milestone, the 100th episode! Each team will prepare a two-course menu for the 100th episode celebration, during which VIP guests will dine on oyster and caviar appetizers and a duck breast entree, followed by a special surprise dish by judge Christina Tosi. The losing team will face the next pressure test, in which contestants must create a three-layer birthday cake in the special.

9.title: Gordon's Greatest Hits
9.plot: In the next challenge, the remaining home cooks will learn from the best as they enter a special taste-it-and-make-it challenge. Each contestant must recreate Gordon Ramsay's signature Beef Wellington. The home cooks with the worst dishes will compete in the next pressure test, featuring another Gordon Ramsay dish - scallops with puree of English peas, bacon and quail eggs, finished with shaved truffles. Find out who can keep up with the master and who will be sent home for good.

10.title: Rice Rice Baby
10.plot: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks will be faced with an assortment of rice. Each contestant must create a rice dish in 60 minutes. The contestant with the winning dish will be featured in Family Circle Magazine and will not have to participate in the next elimination challenge. Then, in the elimination challenge, contestants will be tasked with creating dishes based on dynamic duo ingredients. Find out who will make it into the Top 10 best home cooks in America and who will leave the MASTERCHEF kitchen.

11.title: Moo-vers and Bakers
11.plot: The Top 10 home cooks enter the Wild West when they face their next team challenge and create steak meals for 101 cowboys and ranchers. The team that receives the most winning votes will moo-ve on in the competition, while the remaining home cooks will face the next pressure test. Back in the MASTERCHEF kitchen for the pressure test, the losing team will bake tarts and see who can bake their way to victory.

12.title: Family Reunion
12.plot: The Top 10 home cooks will cook family style when they face their next team challenge and create family style meals for VIP diners. After each team prepares their family style meals, they are greeted by the dinner guests, their family members. Each diner will vote for one team's meal and the team with the most votes will be safe from the next pressure test. In the pressure test, the losing team home cooks must create a gnocchi-in-brown-sage-butter-sauce dish.

13.title: A Little Southern Flare
13.plot: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks must prepare a flambe. The winner of the challenge will not only be safe from the next elimination challenge, but will also determine which Southern dish the contestants must make. The winner also will receive two other significant advantages. Find out whose cooking will go south and who will continue in the competition.

14.title: Getting A-Head in the Competition
14.plot: In the next team challenge, the remaining home cooks will split into teams to prepare vegetarian meals for guests of the MASTERCHEF restaurant. Teams will have access to any ingredients that they choose in the MASTERCHEF pantry, as long as the dishes are vegetarian. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team must cook in the next pressure test and create delicious well-composed meals using various cuts from an animal head. Find out who will move on in the competition and who will leave the kitchen for good.

15.title: A Storm's a Brewing
15.plot: In the next mystery box challenge, the remaining home cooks must create a dish using coffee as one of the main ingredients. The winner of the challenge will receive a significant advantage in the next pressure test and will be safe from elimination. Then, during the pressure test, contestants will team up in pairs as they replicate an elaborate party platter.

16.title: The Restaurant Takeover
16.plot: In the next team challenge, the Top Six home cooks will face the wildly popular restaurant takeover. Each team must complete two appetizer and two entree dishes for the dining guests in a downtown Los Angeles restaurant. The winning team will be safe from elimination, while the losing team must face the next pressure test, in which all members of the losing team must prep, cook and plate three different pasta dishes. Find out who can't stand the heat of the restaurant kitchen and who will move on to the Top 5.

17.title: Return of the Champions
17.plot: In the next mystery box challenge, the Top Five home cooks must create a dish using pear, blue cheese, tomato, portabella mushroom and chocolate. The winner of the challenge receives two advantages: first, he/she will be safe from elimination; then the challenge winner will choose which of four different baskets filled with ingredients - put together on his/her own and with three former MASTERCHEF winners - the remaining contestants must cook with. Find out who will be one step closer to joining the champions and who will be eliminated.

18.title: Think Inside the Box
18.plot: After learning from past champions in last week's episode, the four remaining contestants put that knowledge to use in the next team challenge. Using special ingredients provided by judges Gordon Ramsay and Graham Elliot, each team must create a unique appetizer and entree - and create them three times!. The winning pair will automatically move into the Top Three, while the losing pair must face the next pressure test, in which they must recreate judge Christina Tosi's world-famous Chocolate Malted Layer Cake. Find out who will be eliminated and who will take the cake...

19.title: Team Gordon Ramsay
19.plot: The home cook with the most number of votes will move on in the competition, while the remaining two home cooks will face the next pressure test, during which they must complete three classic MASTERCHEF dishes. The home cook with the best dishes will move on to the finals.

20.title: The Finale
20.plot: In the final challenge in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the Top Two home cooks will have one last chance to prove to the judges that they deserve the MASTERCHEF title by creating a three-course meal. After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, and the deserving home cook will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy, a book deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Find out whose culinary dreams will turn into a reality.

1.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 1
1.plot: In the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Judging the battle rounds will be Ramsay and Tosi, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. In order to move to the next round of the competition, the home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be ...

2.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 2
2.plot: In a continuation of the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America compete head-to-head in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt the to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title. The remaining home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals and make the next round.

3.title: Wolfgang Puck
3.plot: After the Battle of the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America meet the first guest judge of the season - culinary icon Wolfgang Puck, who will introduce the season's first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create a dish of their choice that features one of the world's most fundamental ingredients - potatoes! The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge is rewarded with a significant decision going into the season's first elimination challenge, during which they will have to replicate one of Chef Ramsay's signature dishes in less ...

4.title: A Masterchef Wedding
4.plot: In their first MASTERCHEF field challenge, the Top 18 home cooks are divided in to two teams where they will have to prepare appetizers and entrees for a very special guest and member of the MASTERCHEF family, season 6 contestant Nick Nappi on his wedding day! Not only will they feel the pressure from Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi and a former contestant but also Nick's bride and 72 hungry wedding guests. The winning team will earn a significant advantage in the next elimination challenge.

5.title: A Mexican Mystery
5.plot: After a dramatic elimination, the remaining 17 home cooks are greeted by Chef Ramsay and Tosi, as well as special guests Season Six winner Claudia Sandoval and guest culinary judge Aaron Sanchez, as they reveal the next mystery box challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create his/her own unique dish using a number of Sandoval's favorite ingredients. The winner of the challenge will not only be safe from the next elimination round, but will also help in deciding the fate of three other contestants in the elimination. Find out who is saved and who survives ...

6.title: Gordon Ramsay Masterclass
6.plot: This week, the remaining 16 home cooks get a very special treat leading into the next challenge, as Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to properly deconstruct a lobster. They will then each have 25 minutes to kill, poach and shell a lobster, just as they learned from the master, and the winner will have the advantage of choosing which team he or she will join for the next field challenge. For the second part of the challenge, Chef Ramsay demonstrates how to make lobster tortellini in a seafood broth. The contestants have 45 minutes to recreate Ramsay�۪s dish. ...

7.title: Vets, Jets, and Home Cooks
7.plot: The remaining 15 cooks split up into two teams for their second major field challenge, which includes prepping and serving a steak, two side dishes and a sauce for 101 veterans, whose votes will determine which group will face the pressure test.

8.title: The Good, the Bad and the Offal
8.plot: The contestants are introduced to special culinary guest judge Edward Lee, chef and owner of 610 Magnolia in Louisville, KY, who reveals the third Mystery Box challenge. Contestants lift their boxes only to find a $20 bill. They will each have five minutes to shop for ingredients priced in the pantry without spending more than $20. Then they will have 45 minutes to prepare four entree dishes to present to the judges. Not only will the winner and the winner's dish be featured in Family Circle magazine, but he/she also will avoid having to participate in the elimination...

9.title: A Piece of Cake
9.plot: The contestants were split into two teams to prepare 30 portions for patrons that were celebrating their 16th birthdays. One team won with eighty percent of the votes and the losing team had to bake a three layer cake for the pressure test.

10.title: The Weakest Links
10.plot: The losing contestants from the Sweet 16 Challenge in last week's episode are faced with the Birthday Cake pressure test and will have 90 minutes to bake a three-layer birthday cake. After a dramatic elimination, the remaining contestants are dropped off in the middle of a vegetable field and surprised by the judges - Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi and guest judge Edward Lee - who inform them of their next team field challenge. The teams go head-to-head with 75 minutes to prepare and cook their dishes, followed by 45 minutes to serve more than 100 hungry farmers.

11.title: Sweet Surprise
11.plot: The Top 10 contestants have 60 minutes to prep, cook and plate a Nutella breakfast dish. The winner, who is safe from the next elimination challenge, also gets to choose what dish the other contestants must prepare for the challenge. Will it be paella, bibimbap or risotto.

12.title: 5 Star Food
12.plot: Guest judge Kevin Sbraga cooks alongside the Top Nine in the next Mystery Box Challenge, as they create an impressive dish using unique upscale ingredients. The contestants then go head-to-head in the elimination challenge, cooking with either fresh salmon or canned salmon.

13.title: Hot Potato
13.plot: The Top Eight face a three-part potato skill test. Find out which contestants get eliminated.

14.title: Tag Team
14.plot: The seven remaining cooks compete in their next Mystery Box Challenge using three basic utensils to prepare two dishes. The contestants are paired up and go head-to-head in the elimination challenge to create a picnic platter.

15.title: Pop-Up Restaurant
15.plot: The six remaining contestants compete in the series' classic pop-up restaurant challenge. Find out which contestants get eliminated.

16.title: Family Drama
16.plot: The five remaining contestants are introduced to special culinary guest judge Richard Blais - chef, restaurateur and cookbook author - who reveals the seventh Mystery Box challenge. The winner will avoid competing in the elimination challenge and the remaining contestants are given five minutes to shop for a basket full of twenty ingredients. With an unexpected twist in the competition, one is eliminated.

17.title: Critics Choice
17.plot: The four remaining contestants are given 90 minutes to prepare either a halibut or duck entrée for VIP food critics in the Studio Box challenge. The winning team will be exempt from the elimination challenge and the losing team will face the Pressure Test to recreate three pork dishes. Find out which contestants prove they have what it takes to be in the finale.

18.title: The Finale: Part 1
18.plot: In the next challenge, with help from some familiar home cooks, the remaining three will have 60 minutes to prepare an amazing appetizer dish. In Part Two of the season finale, the contestants will have one hour to create entrees and an hour to create a dessert.

19.title: The Finale: Part 2
19.plot: After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, and the deserving home cook will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy, a book deal and the $250,000 grand prize.Find out whose culinary dreams will turn into a reality.

1.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 1
1.plot: In the Season Eight premiere episode, 40 of America's best home cooks travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle for a White Apron challenge, during which they will face off against each other to try to earn a place in the Top 20. Judging the battle rounds will be Gordon Ramsay, Christina Tosi, and new judge and award-winning chef Aarón Sánchez, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. After each battle, the judges will decide whom they think deserves to make it to the next round and a chance to compete for the coveted title.

2.title: Battle for a White Apron: Part 2
2.plot: In Part Two of the Battle for a White Apron, the remaining chefs compete for a spot in the Top 20. Only nine aprons remain and it will be up to the judges to decide who makes it and who goes home.

3.title: America's Grocery Bag
3.plot: In their first mystery box challenge of the season, the Top 20 will have to take 12 of the most popular ingredients found on any American home cook's shopping list and make the judges a MASTERCHEF-worthy dish. Whoever wins the challenge will have a huge advantage moving forward in the competition.

4.title: Feeding the Lifeguards
4.plot: The Top 19 take it to the sandy shore, where they will compete in their first team challenge of the season. The chefs will have to prepare and cook fresh fish for 101 lifeguards who will then vote on their favorite dish. The losing team will have to compete in a pressure test before the judges send one chef home.

5.title: Shell-Shocked & Scrambled
5.plot: The Top 18 face a mystery box challenge that includes cooking some of the finest shellfish in the world. The winner will receive a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the rest of the chefs to compete in an elimination challenge where they will have to create a Gordon Ramsay classic. It is then up to the judges to decide who will leave the kitchen.

6.title: Silenced by the Lambs
6.plot: This week on MASTERCHEF, the cooks take part in a challenging skills test, during which they must prepare racks of lamb with fine artistry. Those who fail to impress the judges will face an elimination challenge that includes recreating Gordon Ramsay's signature lamb chop dish. It is then up to the judges to decide who will leave the kitchen.

7.title: Breakfast, Lunch & Winner
7.plot: This week on MASTERCHEF, the home cooks head to Beverly Hills, CA, to take over the dining room breakfast service for The Belvedere restaurant at the iconic five-star Peninsula Hotel. After splitting into two teams, the cooks will make a variety of dishes for diners. The team that fails the challenge will have to face a pressure test and cook a perfectly battered fish and chips dish. It is then up to the judges to decide who will leave the kitchen.

8.title: Whole-y Cow!
8.plot: The Top 15 face a mystery box challenge in which they randomly choose from boxes containing a different body part of a cow and use it as the star of a dish. The winner receives a huge advantage moving forward, while those who didn't impress must face off in an elimination challenge. It is then up to the judges to decide who leaves the kitchen.

9.title: Holy Cannoli
9.plot: The MASTERCHEF kitchen is transformed into a full dining room, as it welcomes purveyors of the finest local ingredients, ranging from butchers and vegetable farmers, to beekeepers and herb growers. After splitting into two teams, the home cooks must prepare dishes using the guests' own ingredients. The purveyors will then vote on which team created a better dish, forcing the losing team to head back to the kitchen for a pressure test, during which they will cook a classic Italian dessert, the cannoli. It is then up to the judges to decide who will head home.

10.title: The MasterChef Returns
10.plot: Reigning champion Shaun O'Neale returns to the MASTERCHEF kitchen, as he chooses ingredients from his new cookbook to be part of the mystery box challenge. The winner will receive a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the other chefs to battle it out in a coconut-themed elimination challenge. It is then up to the judges to decide who will head home.

11.title: Vegas Deluxe & Oyster Shucks
11.plot: The Top 12 head to Sin City for a team challenge during which they will serve 50 VIPs in entertainment and hospitality at Caesars Palace for its 50th Anniversary party. Each guest will taste both teams' dishes and then will cast a vote for their favorite dish. The team with the most votes wins, sending the losing team back to the kitchen for a pressure test. It is then up to the judges to decide who will head home.

12.title: In a Pinch
12.plot: In this week's skills test, The Top 11 are given a bag of live crawfish and will have to carefully cook them in order to extract the most meat possible. The six weakest cooks will go head-to-head in an elimination challenge, during which they will make a crawfish dish created by none other than Gordon Ramsay. Then, the Top 10 face a chicken-and-potato team challenge. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

13.title: Gordon's Game of Chicken
13.plot: In this week's skills test, The Top 11 are given a bag of live crawfish and will have to carefully cook them in order to extract the most meat possible. The six weakest cooks will go head-to-head in an elimination challenge, during which they will make a crawfish dish created by none other than Gordon Ramsay. Then, the Top 10 face a chicken-and-potato team challenge. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

14.title: A Mexican Tag Team Challenge
14.plot: In a mystery box challenge, the Top Nine must create a dish that is reminiscent of their favorite family breakfast, using Nutella as the key ingredient. The winner gets a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the rest of the chefs to pair up for a Mexican-themed tag team challenge. Find out which contestants will be eliminated .

15.title: The Great Outdoors
15.plot: The Top Eight head to Big Bear Lake to cook fresh fish. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

16.title: Chopsticks & Pasta
16.plot: In this week's mystery box challenge, the Top Seven must create an Asian-inspired dish that centers around one of the most prominent utensils in culinary history - chopsticks! The winner gets a huge advantage moving forward, leaving the remaining home cooks to compete in a pasta-themed elimination challenge.

17.title: Pop-Up Restaurant
17.plot: The Top Six split up in teams for a classic MASTERCHEF challenge - to cook for food critics, writers and chefs at a pop-up restaurant in a Southern California vineyard. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

18.title: Something Fishy
18.plot: The Top Six split up in teams for a classic MASTERCHEF challenge - to cook for food critics, writers and chefs at a pop-up restaurant in a Southern California vineyard. Find out which contestants will be eliminated.

19.title: The Semi-Finals
19.plot: In this week's mystery box challenge, the Top 6 get a special treat as their family members join them in the MASTERCHEF kitchen. The contestants will then have to cook a dish inspired by their families before competing in an elimination test that will send one or more of them home.

20.title: The Finale: Part 1
20.plot: After countless mystery box, team and skills challenges, it all comes down to this. The final three home cooks will each prepare a three-course meal with ingredients of their choosing. After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, who will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy and a check for $250,000. Find out who will be crowned champion of the kitchen. Part 1.

21.title: The Finale: Part 2
21.plot: After countless mystery box, team and skills challenges, it all comes down to this. The final three home cooks will each prepare a three-course meal with ingredients of their choosing. After evaluating the final dishes, the judges will reveal America's next MASTERCHEF, who will walk away with a MASTERCHEF trophy and a check for $250,000. Find out who will be crowned champion of the kitchen. Part 2.

15.plot: The contestants design a three course meal to impress the judges, showing off their skill, palate, talent, commitment and passion.

imdb.title: Masterchef
plot: A nationwide search for the best home cooks in America. One of 50 hopefuls will become a culinary star and one of America's "_Masterchef_ (qv)s."
